Key Arguments: The legislation is an attack on freedom of speech, a fundamental human right.
The government cannot objectively determine what is true or false.
The vast amount of information available makes it impossible for any group to discern truth from falsehood on every subject.
The proposed law could cause harm by censoring information that may later be proven true, as illustrated by the COVID-19 lab origin theory.
Notable Quotes: This proposed 'misinformation' law is an attack on our basic human rights by a government that is supposed to uphold those rights, not stifle them.
No government body has the wisdom or ability to sort out what is true and what isnâ€™t.
Censoring truthful reporting about the lab leak theory will itself cause 'harm' by preventing us from learning from our mistakes.
